intro: Ossaea pseudopinetorum, commonly known as the false pine moss, is a rare and delicate liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, closely packed leaves that form dense, cushion-like growths, typically found in moist, shaded environments. This plant thrives in cool, humid climates and is often associated with coniferous forests or rocky substrates. Its reproductive structures, known as gemmae, are produced in specialized clusters called gemma cups. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Ossaea pseudopinetorum is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
